0.author: Chris23233
0.content:
Hello,
I have copy and pasted code from the documentation (qml.density_matrix — PennyLane 0.29.1 documentation 1) but am getting the error shown in the attached picture.
Does anyone know how to fix this “device does not provide a native method for computing the jacobian” issue please (See attached image)?

image1290×594 127 KB

1.author: isaacdevlugt
1.content:
Hey @Chris23233! Welcome to the forum! 
I’m not able to replicate your error — the code executes perfectly fine for me . Are you using the most up-to-date version of PennyLane? If you print qml.__version__ it should say 0.29.1 (at the time of writing). If you’re under that, you can upgrade via pip install --upgrade pennylane.
Let me know if that helps!

2.author: Chris23233
2.content:
Thank you for your help Isaac!
It looks like I somehow missed the wires = 2 argument in the dev line. Things work fine now. Thank you!1

3.author: isaacdevlugt
3.content: Awesome! Glad everything works now ! Sorry — I missed that you didn’t have wires=2 as well!1
